text: Albert Leornes Greene (born April 13, 1946), often known as Al Green or The Reverend Al Green, is an American singer-songwriter and record producer. He is best known for recording a series of soul hit singles in the early 1970s, including "Take Me to the River", "Tired of Being Alone", "I'm Still in Love with You", "Love and Happiness", and his signature song, "Let's Stay Together". ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:African-American singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American soul singers Category:American R&B; singers Category:American gospel singers Category:American blues singers Category:American record producers Category:Businesspeople from Arkansas Category:Singers from Arkansas Category:Writers from Arkansas Category:Businesspeople from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:Singers from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:Writers from Grand Rapids, Michigan
title: Al Green
